alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 6:00PM MST until July 27 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 600 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in areas around the northern Dragoon Mountains just south of I-10. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dragoon and Pearce-Sunsites. This includes the following highways... Route 191 between mile markers 57 and 58. Interstate 10 near mile marker 317...and between mile markers 323 and 324. This includes the following streams and drainages... Walnut Wash and Dragoon Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
